tn.text: This is the name of a place in Moab. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This was an act of worship. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
Peor was the name of a mountain. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:num:23:28|23:28]].

The increase in Yahweh's anger is spoken of as if it was a fire starting to burn. This can be stated in active form. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:num:21:19|21:20]]. AT: "Yahweh became very angry" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: all the leaders of the people
tn.text: It is implied that this refers to the leaders who were guilty of idolatry. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "all the leaders of the people who are guilty of idolatry" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: to expose them in the daylight
tn.text: This means that the leaders of Israel will kill these people and leave their dead bodies out where all the people can see them.
"to Israel's leaders who were not guilty of idolatry"
Peor was the name of a mountain. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:num:23:28|23:28]].

tn.ref: brought among his family members a Midianite woman
tn.text: It is implied that he brought her among his camp to have sex with her. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "brought a Midianite woman to the Israelite camp to sleep with her" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: in the sight of Moses and all the community of the people of Israel
tn.text: Here "in the sight of" is an idiom that means they heard about it, or found out about it. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This is the name of Aaron's son. See how you translated it in [[:en:bible:notes:num:03:01|3:2]].
"Phinehas followed"

tn.ref: turned my rage away from the people of Israel
tn.text: God's rage is spoken of as if it were something that could be physically pushed aside in order to stop it. AT: "caused me to no longer be angry with the people of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: I have not consumed the people of Israel in my fierceness
tn.text: God is spoken of as if he were a fierce animal that could have eaten up the people of Israel. AT: "I have not destroyed the people of Israel in my terrible anger" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Therefore say, 'Yahweh says, "Look, I am giving to Phinehas ... the people of Israel."'
tn.text: This continues Yahweh's speech from the previous verse. This has quotations within quotations. The direct quotations can be stated as indirect quotation. AT: "Therefore say to Phinehas that I am giving to him ... the people of Israel." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotesinquotes]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])
This switches from the main storyline to background information about Zimri and Cozbi. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom Phinehas killed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a woman. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
The abstract noun "deceitfulness" can be stated as a verb. AT: "by deceiving you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
"They persuaded you to do this evil thing"

tn.ref: in the case of Peor ... in the matter of Peor
tn.text: Both of these phrases mean that these things happened at Mount Peor.
Peor was the name of a mountain. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:num:23:28|23:28]].
This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom Phinehas killed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
